Judul: Source parameters estimation by the normalized downward continuation of gravity gradient data
Abstrak:
Normalized downward continuation (NDC) method calculates the normalization on the analytical signal
modulus of the downward continued field or the downward continuation of the potential field itself,
which is used to obtain the edges position and buried depth information. In this study, we applied the
NDC method to the edge detector defined as the combination of the directional total horizontal derivatives
(DTHD) to improve the lateral resolution. The iterative downward continuation is introduced in the computation
process which has a large downward continuation distance. The synthetic gravity data with and
without noise are used to test the effectiveness of the new presented approach. The results show that
NDC applied to the edge detector based on DTHD has a better resolution than the previous method based
on the directional analytic signals, and the source edges and depth information can be obtained simultaneously.
Finally, we apply the method to the gravity data acquired over the Humble Salt Dome in USA.
The results show a good correspondence to the previous work results
Kata Kunci: Source parameters Normalized downward continuation Gravity gradient data
